symf.name: OF_CREATE
symf.desc: Creates a new file. If the file exists, it is truncated to zero (0) length.

symf.name: OF_EXIST
symf.desc: Opens a file and then closes it

symf.name: OF_PARSE
symf.desc: Fills the OFSTRUCT structure, but does not do anything else

symf.name: OF_PROMPT
symf.desc: Displays a dialog box if a requested file does not exist. A dialog box informs a user that the system cannot find a file, and it contains Retry and Cancel buttons. The Cancel button directs OpenFile to return a file-not-found error message.

symc.name: OF_READ
symc.desc: Opens a file for reading only

symf.name: OF_READWRITE
symf.desc: Opens a file with read/write permissions

symf.name: OF_REOPEN
symf.desc: Opens a file by using information in the reopen buffer

symf.name: OF_SHARE_DENY_NONE
symf.desc: Opens a file without denying read or write access to other processes

symf.name: OF_SHARE_DENY_WRITE
symf.desc: Opens a file and denies write access to other processes

symf.name: OF_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE
symf.desc: Opens a file with exclusive mode, and denies both read/write access to other processes. If a file has been opened in any other mode for read/write access, even by the current process, the function fails.

symf.name: OF_WRITE
symf.desc: Opens a file for write access only
